title: The Businessman Grateful for Trump’s Tariffs
summary: A small company in northern Mexico had faced steep competition from China in making straps, plugs, fasteners, grommets, zip ties and clamps. Now, U.S. tariffs have driven a spike in his business.

title: What Happened in Trade Talks Between Japan and the U.S.
summary: Tokyo had expected smooth tariff negotiations but is experiencing whiplash, becoming a central target of President Trump’s trade frustrations.

title: South Korea Keeps Its Chin Up as Trump Wields Tariff Threat
summary: The country’s new president, in office for a little over a month, had just dispatched his senior deputies to Washington to try to work out a trade deal.

title: Trump’s New Trade Threats, and the Return of Land Mines
summary: Plus, your next job interview might be with A.I.

title: What We Saw in the Texas Flood Zone
summary: Search-and-rescue teams have been hoping against hope to find signs of life after the Texas floods. Nicholas Bogel-Burroughs, an investigative reporter at The New York Times, describes what he has seen in Texas.

title: Trump Looks to Avoid Casting Blame in Texas Flood as Democrats Question Cuts
summary: The White House rebuked critics for raising questions about the administration’s efforts to shrink federal agencies that deal with disaster preparedness and response.

title: Trump and Netanyahu Meet Amid Gaza Cease-Fire Negotiations
summary: The two confronted an array of high-stakes Middle East issues. But first they took a victory lap, including the Israeli leader telling President Trump he had nominated him for a Nobel Peace Prize.

title: 5 Israeli Soldiers Killed in Gaza, Military Says
summary: Officials said the deaths occurred during combat in the north of the enclave but offered few other details.

title: Sweden’s Secret to Well-Being? Tiny Urban Gardens.
summary: Known as koloniträdgårdar, they provide city dwellers access to nature, fresh produce and community.

title: Trump Wants to Close the U.S. Chemical Safety and Hazard Investigation Board
summary: The White House is planning to eliminate the board, a small agency that investigates chemical disasters to understand what went wrong.

title: Trump Pledges to Send More Weapons to Ukraine
summary: “They have to be able to defend themselves,” the president said, appearing to signal a reversal after his administration paused some weapons transfers just last week.

title: ‘Diddy Parties’ Became a Meme. The Combs Case Was About Something Else.
summary: The sweep of graphic lawsuits accusing Sean Combs of sex abuse led to a sense that his criminal case might examine celebrity debauchery in the music industry. It did not.

title: Europe Needs Rare Earth Metals. Can a Factory in Seaside France Supply Them?
summary: The continent wants to reduce the risks of depending so heavily on China for the valuable minerals. The question is how.

title: Macron’s U.K. State Visit: Migrants and the War in Ukraine Are on the Agenda
summary: President Emmanuel Macron’s state visit to Britain, which began Tuesday, will be heavy on pageantry. But both he and Prime Minister Keir Starmer hope for practical results.

title: Lawrence Summers: This Law Made Me Ashamed of My Country
summary: A focus on economics misses the human brutality that is the most problematic aspect of this legislation

title: The Last Words of a Dying Glacier
summary: A glacier is disappearing. An artist is trying to preserve its sound.

title: A Lost Summer Idyll
summary: We explore the particular horror of a disaster at a summer camp.

title: Jon Stewart Thinks Congress Is Basically Pro Wrestling Without the Fun
summary: The “Daily Show” host said the drama around President Trump’s big policy bill was about as authentic as a World Wrestling Entertainment match.

title: The Brothers Who Came Face to Face in Myanmar’s War
summary: Bloody conflict has splintered many families in Myanmar over the past four years. But for one set of siblings, a surprise reunion was joyful, if bittersweet.

title: OpenAI and Microsoft Bankroll New A.I. Training for Teachers
summary: The American Federation of Teachers said it would use the $23 million, including $500,000 from the A.I. start-up Anthropic, to create a national training center.

title: Dan Osborn to Seek Pete Ricketts’s Nebraska Senate Seat, Stressing Class Issues
summary: A steamfitter and former union leader, running as an independent but with Democratic support, will take on the Republican incumbent, a billionaire’s son.

title: TSA to End Shoe Removal Requirement at Airport Security Checkpoints
summary: Most passengers had been required to remove their footwear at checkpoints since 2006, a policy later eased only for members of trusted traveler programs.
